page.syntax: P a5_open_default_browse(C table_set_name [,C filter [,C order [,C description [,C options [,L enable_show_all [,* arguments ]]]]]])

argument.name: table_set_name
argument.description: The name of the table or set to display. Character

argument.name: filter
argument.description: Optional. Default = .T. (all records). A character filter expressionthat evaluates to a logical value. Selects records from the table.

argument.name: order
argument.description: Optional. Default = record order. A character order expressionthat sorts selected records.

argument.name: description
argument.description: The description that you assign to the query that Alpha Anywhere creates when the browse is opened.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Optional. Default = Record order, ascending, not unique. Controls whether Alpha Anywhere uses an index, a new query list, or an existing query list to satisfy a query. This string can contain one or more of the following codes:

item.name: N
item.description: Builds a query list even if an index matches the query definition.

item.name: D
item.description: The descending order option puts the records in descending alphabetical order or, for a numeric field, from highest to lowest value.

item.name: T
item.description: Temporary query. Alpha Anywhere will automatically delete this query if necessary if building a new query would cause it to run out of query slots. there are a maximum of 16 query slots.

item.name: U
item.description: The unique option includes only unique records in the query list.

item.name: M
item.description: Builds a new query list even though a) an existing query list exists, and b) an existing Index exists (both of which, Alpha Anywhere could have used rather than running a new query).

item.name: X
item.description: Use an index even if an existing query exists (which Alpha Anywhere would otherwise have used in preference to the index).

item.name: I
item.description: The I flag is obsolete. It was used by Alpha Five V1 to indicate that the index should be case-insensitive. However since V2, Alpha Five automatically builds all indexes as Case-insensitive. It is documented because in some situations, the Script Recorder will show Xbasic code that includes the "I" flag.

argument.name: enable_show_all
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .F. Specifies whether the Show All icon that appears on the toolbar is enabled. .T. = Icon enabled, .F. = Icon not enabled.

page.description: Opens the default Browse for a table or set.
page.discussion: The A5_OPEN_DEFAULT_BROWSE() function displays the default browse for the selected table or set. If you specify an optional filter and order, you can give the query a description (which shows up when you press Control I to display the index selector). options are the standard options that apply the to .query_create() method. If you do not want the user to remove the filter/order that you specified for the default browse, you would want Show_Allicon to be disabled. otherwise the user could press the icon and remove the filter that you specified. Limitations: Desktop applications only.
